gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint John
gospel.text:
[[Jn 6,16]]When it was evening, the disciples of Jesus went down to the sea,
[[Jn 6,17]]embarked in a boat, and went across the sea to Capernaum. It had already grown dark, and Jesus had not yet come to them.
[[Jn 6,18]]The sea was stirred up because a strong wind was blowing.
[[Jn 6,19]]When they had rowed about three or four miles, they saw Jesus walking on the sea and coming near the boat, and they began to be afraid.
[[Jn 6,20]]But he said to them, "It is I. Do not be afraid."
[[Jn 6,21]]They wanted to take him into the boat, but the boat immediately arrived at the shore to which they were heading.

psalm.title: Psalms
psalm.text:
[[Ps 33,1]]Exult, you just, in the LORD; 
Praise from the upright is fitting.
[[Ps 33,2]]Give thanks to the LORD on the harp; 
With the ten stringed lyre chant his praises

[[Ps 33,4]]For upright is the word of the LORD, 
and all his works are trustworthy.
[[Ps 33,5]]He loves justice and right; 
of the kindness of the LORD the earth is full.

[[Ps 33,18]]See, the eyes of the LORD are upon those who fear him, 
upon those who hope for his kindness,
[[Ps 33,19]]To deliver them from death 
and preserve them in spite of famine.

first_reading.text:
[[Ac 6,1]]As the number of disciples continued to grow,  the Hellenists complained against the Hebrews  because their widows  were being neglected in the daily distribution.
[[Ac 6,2]]So the Twelve called together the community of the disciples and said, "It is not right for us to neglect the word of God to serve at table.
[[Ac 6,3]]Brothers, select from among you seven reputable men, filled with the Spirit and wisdom, whom we shall appoint to this task,
[[Ac 6,4]]whereas we shall devote ourselves to prayer and to the ministry of the word."
[[Ac 6,5]]The proposal was acceptable to the whole community, so they chose Stephen, a man filled with faith and the holy Spirit, also Philip, Prochorus, Nicanor, Timon, Parmenas, and Nicholas of Antioch, a convert to Judaism.
[[Ac 6,6]]They presented these men to the apostles who prayed and laid hands on them.
[[Ac 6,7]]The word of God continued to spread, and the number of the disciples in Jerusalem increased greatly; even a large group of priests were becoming obedient to the faith.
first_reading.title: Acts of the Apostles
